Name: Alma Redemptoris Mater
Latin: Alma Redemptóris Mater, quæ pérvia cæli(brk)Porta manes, et stella maris, succúrre cadénti,(brk)Súrgere qui curat pópulo: tu quæ genuísti,(brk)Natúra miránte, tuum sanctum Genitórem(brk)Virgo prius ac postérius, Gabriélis ab ore(brk)Sumens illud Ave, peccatórum miserére.
English: Loving mother of the Redeemer,(brk)gate of heaven, star of the sea,(brk)assist your people who have fallen yet strive to rise again,(brk)To the wonderment of nature you bore your Creator,(brk)yet remained a virgin after as before,(brk)You who received Gabriel's joyful greeting,(brk)have pity on us poor sinners

Name: Ave Regina Caelorum
Latin: Ave, Regina caelorum,(brk)Ave, Domina Angelorum:(brk)Salve, radix, salve, porta(brk)Ex qua mundo lux est orta:(brk)Gaude, Virgo gloriosa,(brk)Super omnes speciosa,(brk)Vale, o valde decora,(brk)Et pro nobis Christum exora.
English: Hail, O Queen of Heaven.(brk)Hail, O Lady of Angels(brk)Hail! thou root, hail! thou gate(brk)From whom unto the world a light has arisen:(brk)Rejoice, O glorious Virgin,(brk)Lovely beyond all others,(brk)Farewell, most beautiful maiden,(brk)And pray for us to Christ.

Name: Regina Caeli
Latin: Regina caeli, laetare, alleluia:(brk)Quia quem meruisti portare, alleluia,(brk)Resurrexit, sicut dixit, alleluia:(brk)Ora pro nobis Deum, alleluia.
English: Queen of heaven, rejoice, alleluia.(brk)The Son you merited to bear, alleluia,(brk)Has risen as he said, alleluia.(brk)Pray to God for us, alleluia.

Time Sung: After Eastertide through Saturday before Advent
Name: Salve Regina
Latin: Salve, Regina, Mater misericordiæ,(brk)vita, dulcedo, et spes nostra, salve.(brk)Ad te clamamus exsules filii Hevæ,(brk)Ad te suspiramus, gementes et flentes(brk)in hac lacrimarum valle.(brk)Eia, ergo, advocata nostra, illos tuos(brk)misericordes oculos ad nos converte:(brk)Et Jesum, benedictum fructum ventris tui,(brk)nobis post hoc exsilium ostende.(brk)O clemens, O pia, O dulcis Virgo Maria.
English: Hail, holy Queen, Mother of Mercy,(brk)Hail our life, our sweetness and our hope.(brk)To thee do we cry,(brk)Poor banished children of Eve:(brk)To thee do we send up our sighs,(brk)Mourning and weeping in this valley of tears.(brk)Turn then, most gracious advocate,(brk)Thine eyes of mercy toward us:(brk)And after this our exile,(brk)Show unto us the blessed fruit of thy womb, Jesus.(brk)O clement, O loving,(brk)O sweet Virgin Mary.
